result.execSummary:
The defendant Damond D Connor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.

Restitution set at zero.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
Take only prescribed legal drugs.
May not vote in any election until civil rights have been restored.
Provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $2500 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid from bail on depost.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damond D Connor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Black River Correctional Center W6898 East Staffon Road Black River Falls WI 54615

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  

It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.

It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 7, Judge McAdams..
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded AS TO COUNT ONE:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for FOUR  YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of ONE YEAR SIX MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of TWO YEARS SIX MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for SEVEN DAYS .
Defendant is  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is  eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8-19-2018 ; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8-19-2018 ; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-take only prescribed legal drugs

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Damond D Connor in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT TWO:

Fine of $2500.00 including all mandatory  costs, fees and  dna surcharges  to be paid from bail on deposit. 

NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

Defendant Damond D Connor in court with attorney Matthew R Meyer.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case was calendared for plea and sentence this date.  Defense request for a final pretrial date and a jury trial date is granted by the court.  Parties are informed that effective 08-02-14 this case will be reassigned to Branch 47 - Judge John Siefert due to rotation.  Scheduling order received and filed.  Jury trial scheduled for 09-03-2014 at 09:00 am.
JUSTICE POINT report dsated 07-03-14 received and filed.

Court orders bench warrant imposed and stayed until next court date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Branch 15.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Court advises defendant to continue cooperation with supervision.

Defendant Damond D Connor in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.

Defendant Damond D Connor in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Damond D Connor in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
